features: CLOSE, SMOOTH SHAVING: With a patented six-blade shaving platform, Dorco Pace 6 Pro glides gently across the face. A precision trimmer on the back of the cartridge details for hard-to-reach areas such as sideburns, under the nose, or around the neck.
DOUBLE LUBRICATING STRIPS: A soothing blend of aloe vera, argan oil, and avocado oil helps the blades glide effortlessly while moisturizing the skin to effectively reduce irritation.

OPEN BLADE DESIGN: Allows for easy rinsing of the blades, which can help to keep them sharp and clean for a longer period of time. You'll be able to get multiple shaves out of each blade, saving you money and reducing waste.
DORCO’S CURVED BLADES: Our blades are curved, slim, and flexible, engineered for a close, comfortable shave.
INTERCHANGEABLE RAZOR HEADS: Any Dorco blade refill fits any Dorco razor handle. They ensure a safe and comfortable shaving experience for all skin types, including sensitive skin.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My favorite type of razor
reviews.reviewText: I ended up getting these razors because of a reddit post about how good they are. I think these razors are really nice as they do what I need them to do. I usually just keep using the same blades until I have a hard time shaving which takes about a month or two for me (depending on frequency and I just use water).Overall, the 12 pack refills take me about half a year or 3/4 of the year to go through

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Got my blades back!
reviews.reviewText: When dollar shave club cancelled the executive razor blades, I was super upset. I had been using them for years. After researching rhe internet for a bit, I found that these were the exact replacement only under the manufacturers name. No more razor burn from the new DSC blades. Thanks for selling them here!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Will be buying these from now on
reviews.reviewText: My husband used to purchase razors from our local drugstores when I found these on Amazon he was skeptical at first, because he’s very particular about using razors to shave his head he would get nicks and cuts and not a very close shave. Once you use them, he instantly like them. He got the Close shave and to his surprise. No nicks no cuts. He highly recommends these.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good cheaper razors
reviews.reviewText: My wife and I use these razor blades and like them. They are cheaper but are still good quality. They achieve a close shave and leave our skin feeling smooth. Most cheap razors cut your skin but these ones don't which is good. They do dull quicker than the normal expensive razors but that's expected for how cheap they are. We change the blades once a week and have no issues. Would highly recommend these razors if your looking for a good cheaper blade that you don't mind changing weekly.

reviews.reviewText: Excellent shaves. Normally get two or three times the number of shaves per blade then other brands. Hats off.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Give the Pace 6 a try
reviews.reviewText: I've been shaving for over twenty years and have used all kinds of razors. If you're thinking about buying this razor you should give it a try. It is priced right so you don't have much to lose. At first I thought 6 blades were overkill. I had already tried the Pace 3 and Pace 4 and liked them both. So I wanted to try the razor that appeared to be Dorco's best effort.The 6 blades do not irritate my skin. There seems to be something about the design that protects the skin from irritation, but I can't explain it. They are very good for mowing down thick stubble. I find I can rinse it off less frequently because those 6 blades just keep doing the job. They don't drag, just glide. I can even shave with slower strokes and they just glide through the stubble. They never get clogged even when I am using a thick pre-shave oil. They always rinse clean with ease. I've had other razors clog up, but not these. The blades also give this great audio feedback when the stubble is being cut. So when I'm in the shower stall and using a clear cream like Cremo, I can hear what is going on even if it is hard to see. I love this feature.The trimmer works great. It takes a little getting used to (as all new razors do) but I find it works better then the Fusion. I found the original Fusion trimmer clogged up bad. This trimmer doesn't clog. Once I got used to the angle and pressure needed, it worked very well.I have a thick coarse beard and have used this razor 10 times and it is still shaving like new. I predict I will get many more shaves out of this first cartridge.Also I believe that a shave with any razor will be bad if you don't prep your skin well. The right products and technique will make the most difference in a shave. But even in the instances when I didn't have time for a hot shower, pre-shave oil, premium cream or any of the nice things a home shave gets me, this razor performed well enough. A quick spash of hot water in the sink, and some canned shave gel still got the job done without incident. So the razor passed the test even in my worst case scenario of shaving.If there are any negatives about this razor I would say it is the size of the cartridge. The trimmer solves most of the size issues. However sometimes shaving around the curve of my chin the rubber guard and lubrication strip wouldn't make contact with my skin and the razors would be the only part making contact and nick. Yet I got used to it very quickly and am not having an issue with it. As with any new razor, I find as I got more used to the razor the shaves got better and better. My recent shaves have all been nick free and very close.

El producto lo conocí por casualidad, ya que un "entrepreneus" de Amazon lo vendia quitándole el empaque original y poniéndole el suyo. Al ver el producto vi la marca real. No le pongo 5 estrellas por que su cabezal no es movil, pero definitivamente con menos pasadas quedas mejor que la Gillette match ultra de 5 navajas, y el precio es mas atractivo. Solo es cosa de acostumbrarse a darle pasadas rectas de nuevo y asi no te irritas.
